title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {dukecvd: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors},   author = {Aidan Gildea},   year = {2022},   note = {https://github.com/aidangildea/dukecvd, https://aidangildea.github.io/dukecvd/}, }

what: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors
title: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors
text: goal dukecvd generate Duke official color blind friendly visualizations.

title: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors
text: can install development version dukecvd GitHub :

title: Makes color blind friendly visualizations with Duke's official colors
text: basic example shows solve common problem: Sample visualization:
code: library(dukecvd) ## basic example code plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(iris, ggplot2::aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width)) +   ggplot2::geom_point(ggplot2::aes(colour = Species)) +   ggplot2::labs(title = "This Title is in Duke Royal Blue!", caption = "This caption is in Duke Navy Blue!", x = "This is copper!", y = "This is Persimmon!")  plot + theme_duke()

title: Theme Duke — theme_duke
code: theme_duke(   base_size = 11,   base_family = "",   base_line_size = base_size/22,   base_rect_size = base_size/22 )

title: Theme Duke — theme_duke
text: base_size base size base_family base family base_line_size baseline size base_rect_size base rect

title: Theme Duke — theme_duke
code: plot <- ggplot2::ggplot(cars, ggplot2::aes(speed, dist)) + ggplot2::geom_point() + ggplot2::labs(title = "Duke Blue") plot + theme_duke() #> Error in check_font_path(regular, "regular"): font file not found for 'regular' type
